intro: Kosteletzkya borkouana, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in the morning and close by midday, adapting to the harsh sunlight. Its leaves are typically fleshy and succulent, allowing it to store water efficiently. Kosteletzkya borkouana is well-suited to sandy soils and can thrive in environments with low rainfall.
